description:
PCSX2 is a free and open-source PlayStation 2 (PS2) emulator. Its purpose is to emulate the PS2's hardware, using a combination of MIPS CPU Interpreters,
Recompilers and a Virtual Machine which manages hardware states and PS2 system memory. This allows you to play PS2 games on your PC, with many additional features and benefits.
	
### Package Specific

This package version uses an AutoHotKey to run the installer, as the silent switch is broken for this package version.

#### Package Parameters
The following package parameters can be set:

 * `/DesktopShortcut` - Add a desktop shortcut
 
To pass parameters, use `--params "''"` (e.g. `choco install packageID [other options] --params="'/ITEM:value /ITEM2:value2 /FLAG_BOOLEAN'"`).
To have choco remember parameters on upgrade, be sure to set `choco feature enable -n=useRememberedArgumentsForUpgrades`.
author: arcum42, avih, gregory, pseudonym, rama, Refraction
